title: FluffyMuffin005
author: FluffyMuffin005
content: I am looking to create a mining pool in the very near future.  I saw some posts on these forums about it, but they were fairly dated.  I thought I saw previously that Antpool had a cloud template available for standing up your own mining pool, but I cannot find any details at this point.  I already have the mining infrastructure available so that is not of a concern.  Let me know if anyone has any feedback or if anyone might be interested in collaborating on this project.

comments.author: Sledge0001
comments.created_time: March 31, 2023, 12:55:16 AMLast edit: March 31, 2023, 02:37:59 AM by Sledge0001
comments.body: I would tell you personally that hat I've been down this road and there are inherent issues with all of the open source mining pool code that's out there. Simply put don't trust any free pool code that's out there even as a starting point.I concluded after many fruitless tests with most open source pool code and efforts to work with others in the space to get something useful built is a waste of time.The only solution for me was and still is to start coding everything uniquely from the ground up. It's the only way to make sure the code is controlled and written properly and works the way you intended it to.

comments.author: mikeywith
comments.body: Quote from: FluffyMuffin005 on March 30, 2023, 11:59:55 PMI already have the mining infrastructure available so that is not of a concern. You don't need any mining infrastructure to operate a mining pool, the same way you don't need to operate a pool to run the mining infrastructure.With that said, there are no plug-and-play pools that can be deployed as a final product, start by looking at open-source projects like Ckpool, I know that someone recently deployed a pool and had to hire Con Kolivas to make the Ckpool operational.

This of course after KitKatz went rogue on me which wasn't as kind...It's actually a good thing since at this point I'm deep into fully unique pool code which some assumed i wouldn't be able to do or figure out.There's nothing better than proving someone wrong when they make assumptions about your skill level or determination.

comments.author: FluffyMuffin005
comments.body: Thank you both for the replies and I appreciate all of the candid feedback.  I am still looking to move forward with this project, but it seems like the best option would be to build a mining pool from scratch.  Would either of you (or anyone in this forum) know of any solid software dev teams I could hire for something like this?  Any recommendations would be much appreciated!

comments.author: kano
comments.body: Reminder you have to trust everyone who develops and runs your pool for you,forever, and assume none of them will keep access to your servers and abscond with any of your BTC.Simplest solution is to actually e.g. run solo on my pool if your aim is a sizeable hash rate running on your own.Then your trust is just me and you also don't have to pay people to run the pool, handle alerts and problems and be responsive 24/7/365Have a read: https://kano.is/index.php?k=poolThere are other options for large miners.

comments.author: FluffyMuffin005
comments.body: Hi Kano, Thank you for reaching out as well as the offer to join your pool.  We are working on a pretty large project at this point which is why we are looking to start our own.  I know there is definitely a lot of trust that needs to go into this, but we will have the appropriate check and balances for everything.  Let me know if you happen to know a Software Dev Company you could refer me to or if that is something you might be interested in participating in as well.

comments.author: hZti
comments.body: Quote from: FluffyMuffin005 on May 09, 2023, 05:18:10 PM Thank you for reaching out as well as the offer to join your pool.  We are working on a pretty large project at this point which is why we are looking to start our own.   If you are investing heavily into creating a pool then also dont forget, that a pool can only be successful if you have enough users on that pool. Only with a large enough hashrate you can have a steady income and dont have to gamble to find a block every few month. This is also why many new pools fail, because they will simply not be able to find people to mine with them in the beginning. After the pool becomes more popular it also becomes pretty easy to find new miners however.
